question: Have any new risks emerged for Apple recently, and how is management addressing them?
result_lines: Services also grew during the quarter.
And the Mac and iPad suffered from the same issues that the company did with the compare issues to factory disruptions in Q3 that were filled subsequently in Q4 of '22.
In addition to that, we had the top 4 selling phones in urban China for last year.
translated_lines: 맥과 아이패드도 2022년 3분기 공장 중단 문제로 인한 비교 문제와 같은 문제를 겪었으며, 이 문제들은 이후 4분기에 해결되었습니다.
그에 더해, 우리는 작년 중국 도시 지역에서 가장 많이 팔린 상위 4개의 휴대폰을 보유하고 있었습니다.
chunk:
Yes. If you look at how we did in Greater China for the quarter, we came in at, on revenue basis, minus 2. But one thing to keep in mind here is that the FX impact was nearly 6 points. So we grew in constant currency. And underneath that, if you look at the different -- the categories, iPhone actually set a September quarter record in Mainland China.

And the -- what pulled down the performance was a combination largely of Mac and iPad. Services also grew during the quarter. And the Mac and iPad suffered from the same issues that the company did with the compare issues to factory disruptions in Q3 that were filled subsequently in Q4 of '22. In addition to that, we had the top 4 selling phones in urban China for last year. And I was -- I just -- I took a trip over there and could not be more excited about the interactions I had with customers and employees and others.

question: Have any new risks emerged for Apple recently, and how is management addressing them?
result_lines: Just really quick on the extra week dynamic.
There was also, last year, an issue with the iPhone production, where there was the COVID lockdowns in China.

Is it possible to give some color around what that -- I guess, having a normalized supply chain somewhat this year, what that benefit is this year and maybe contrast that with the 7-point hit from the extra week?
translated_lines: 추가 주간 동향에 대해 정말 간단히 말씀드리겠습니다.
작년에도 중국에서의 COVID 봉쇄로 인해 아이폰 생산에 문제가 있었습니다.
올해 어느 정도 정상화된 공급망을 갖는 것이 어떤 이점이 있는지, 그리고 추가된 한 주로 인한 7포인트 손실과 이를 대비해서 설명해 주실 수 있나요?
chunk: Got it. Next one for Luca. Just really quick on the extra week dynamic. There was also, last year, an issue with the iPhone production, where there was the COVID lockdowns in China. Is it possible to give some color around what that -- I guess, having a normalized supply chain somewhat this year, what that benefit is this year and maybe contrast that with the 7-point hit from the extra week?

question: Have any new risks emerged for Apple recently, and how is management addressing them?
result_lines: I mentioned during the prepared remarks, the extra week is 7 points of revenue.
We did have disruptions, supply disruptions last year on the phone, on the 14 Pro and Pro Max in the December quarter a year ago.
And when we normalize for those 2 factors, I said it during the call, we still expect to grow on iPhone.
translated_lines: 준비된 발언 중에 언급했듯이, 추가 한 주는 7포인트의 수익입니다.
우리는 작년 12월 분기에 14 Pro와 Pro Max 전화기 공급에 차질이 있었습니다.
그리고 그 두 가지 요인을 정규화했을 때, 통화 중에 말했듯이, 우리는 여전히 아이폰에서 성장이 있을 것으로 기대합니다.
chunk: Yes. Thanks for the question, Ben. I mentioned during the prepared remarks, the extra week is 7 points of revenue. We did have disruptions, supply disruptions last year on the phone, on the 14 Pro and Pro Max in the December quarter a year ago. And when we normalize for those 2 factors, I said it during the call, we still expect to grow on iPhone. So you take into account the loss of the extra week, you compare it with the supply disruptions that are not going to repeat hopefully this year. And when you normalize for those 2 things, we still expect to grow on iPhone.
